Module Collections
Package collections.bits

Class Bits

java.lang.Object
collections.bits.Bits
public class Bits extends Object
A custom bit manipulation class for managing bits more efficiently than java.util.BitSet, especially when dealing with more than 64 bits. This class allows for setting, clearing, and retrieving bits at specific indices.

This class should be chosen over java.util.BitSet if you want slightly faster operations with bits. This class is also unsafe compared to java.util.BitSet as there are no checks for incorrect parameters and no errors thrown specific to this class if an illegal operation has occurred. The purpose for this is to remove as many branches as possible.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Bits

      public Bits(int size)
      Initializes a new instance of the Bits class with the specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - The number of bits in the Bits collection.

  • Method Details

    • valueOf

      public static Bits valueOf(byte[] byteArray)
      Creates a new Bits instance from the given byte array. The bits are read from the byte array in little-endian order.
      Parameters:
      byteArray - The byte array representing the Bits.
      Returns:
      A new Bits instance with bits set according to the byte array.

    • set

      public void set(int index)
      Sets the bit at the specified index to 1 (true). If the index is outside the current capacity, the internal array is resized.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the bit to set.

    • clear

      public void clear(int index)
      Clears the bit at the specified index, setting it to 0 (false).
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the bit to clear.

    • get

      public boolean get(int index)
      Gets the state of the bit at the specified index. If the index is out of bounds, false is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the bit to check.
      Returns:
      true if the bit is set (1), false if it's clear (0).

    • nextSetBit

      public int nextSetBit(int fromIndex)
      Finds and returns the index of the next set bit (bit with value 1) starting from the specified index.
      Parameters:
      fromIndex - The starting index for the search.
      Returns:
      The index of the next set bit or -1 if none are found.

    • nextClearBit

      public int nextClearBit(int fromIndex)
      Finds and returns the index of the next clear bit (bit with value 0) starting from the specified index.
      Parameters:
      fromIndex - The starting index for the search.
      Returns:
      The index of the next clear bit or -1 if none are found.

    • clearAll

      public void clearAll()
      Clears all bits in the Bits collection, setting them to 0.

    • resizeTo

      public void resizeTo(int size)
      Resize the internal array to the specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - The new size of the Bits collection.

    • size

      public int size()
      Gets the current size of the Bits collection.
      Returns:
      The number of bits in the Bits collection.

    • toByteArray

      public byte[] toByteArray()
      Converts the Bits to a byte array. The resulting byte array represents the bits stored in little-endian order.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the Bits.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a binary string representation of the Bits collection, showing the bits stored in the long words.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A binary string representing the contents of the Bits collection.
